page.title: 01THE PARISH OF GROVE
page.content: The village of Grove is built on a hill at the centre of this area.On a clear day the views are outstanding with Lincoln cathedral and Belvoir castle appearing in the distance.The village has no shops,public houses, or surgeries. The Garden Centre includes a small cafe and newspapers are delivered via a private house.The centre of the village buildings is the Church.It is dedicated to Saint Helen, but with no clergy residing in the village,it has very limited Services. The churchyard is still in use.The area is almost entirely agricultural and was formerly part of the Grove Estate.The area is not served by main or secondary roads,has no public service transport and no village school. The village hall has fallen into a state of neglect.
